title: PHPfilectime()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPfilectime()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content: Example Get last change time of "webdictionary.txt": "; echo "Last changed: ".date("F d Y H:i:s.", filectime("webdictionary.txt")); ?> Run Example » Definition and Usage The filectime() function returns the last time a file was changed. This function checks for inode changes as well as regular changes. Inode changes is when permissions, owner, group or other metadata is changed. Tip: Use the filemtime() function to return the last time the file content was changed. Note: The result of this function is cached. Use clearstatcache() to clear the cache. Syntax filectime( filename ) Parameter Values Parameter Description filename Required. Specifies the path to the file to check Technical Details Return Value: The last change time as a Unix timestamp on success, FALSE on failure PHP Version: 4.0+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code: "; echo "Last changed: ".date("F d Y H:i:s.", filectime("webdictionary.txt")); ?>
